intro: Hedyotis pusilla, commonly known as the small marsh woundwort, is a small herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Hedyotis pusilla is adapted to moist environments and is often found in marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds.
